publication.title: AutoMoDe - Model-Based Development of Automotive Software
publication.authors: dirk ziegenbein,ulrich freund,andreas bauer,jan romberg,bernhard schätz

publication.title: Checking and Transforming Models with AutoFOCUS
A Model-Based Approach for Automotive Software Development
publication.jconf: Object-Oriented Modeling of Embedded Real-Time Systems
publication.keyword: Development Process;Distributed Networks;Domain Specificity;Integrable Model;model-based approach;Modeling Language;Software Development;System Modeling;Unified Modeling Language;Electronic Control Unit;
publication.abstract: Integrated model-based specification techniques facilitate the definition of seamless development processes for electronic control units (ECUs) including support for domain specific issues such as management of signals, the integration of isolated logical functions or the deployment of functions to distributed networks of ECUs. A fundamental prerequisite of such approaches is the existence of an adequate modeling notation tailored to the

publication.title: Consistent Integration of Formal Methods
publication.jconf: Tools and Algorithms for Construction and Analysis of Systems

publication.title: AutoMoDe - Model-Based Development of Automotive Software
publication.authors: dirk ziegenbein,ulrich freund,andreas bauer,jan romberg,bernhard schätz

publication.title: Model-Based Safety-Cases for Software-Intensive Systems
publication.jconf: Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science
publication.abstract: Safety cases become increasingly important for software certication. Models play a crucial role in building and combining information for the safety case. This position paper sketches an ideal model-based safety case with defect hypotheses and failure characterisations. From this, open research issues are derived.
